speaker: Maelle
line: If you’re gonna give someone flowers, you should probably do it BEFORE they wither and die.

speaker: Gustave
line: What, the flower? Or Sophie?

speaker: Maelle
line: Ooh, dark. Sophie would approve. Hey, you said it, not me. The others are waiting for you, you’re supposed to be helping with the festival.

speaker: Gustave
line: With what? Putting three tables? They’ll manage.

speaker: Maelle
line: Ah. You underestimate Lumière’s enthusiasm for the Expedition. There’s at least FIVE tables.

speaker: Gustave
line: Marvellous.

speaker: Maelle
line: Have you tried throwing with your other arm instead? If you could hit the Paintress directly, that would actually be useful.

speaker: Gustave
line: You know, hobbies don’t always have to be useful. I’m enjoying the uselessness of today, and readying my usefulness for tomorrow. And soon, we’ll get to do a lot more than throw rocks.

speaker: Maelle
line: That’s what all the other expeditions said too.

speaker: Gustave
line: Heyheyhey. You know, you know they gave their lives to lay the trail for us, right?

speaker: Maelle
line: Yeah, I know, sorry.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah.

speaker: Maelle
line: You still got a flower to give, no?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yes, yes. It’s just… I’m not sure how to start. After four years apart, what do I say to her, on the day of her Gommage.

speaker: Maelle
line: You’re asking ME? I dunno, sun’s about to set, so… be direct? “Hey Soph-been a while. Could we–”

speaker: Maelle
line: All right, let’s go. I’ll accompany you there. Are you… ready to see her again?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, been ready.

speaker: Maelle
line: I set up these grapple shortcuts. Nice, huh? Don’t tell your sister, though. I sort of “borrowed” the hooks from the Expedition Academy. Wish I had them when I was working as a courier… Come on, Gustave, speed up a bit. Sophie will have already gommaged by the time you’ve arrived.

speaker: Gustave
line: Maelle.

speaker: Maelle
line: I can’t believe Sophie already turned 33… She looks so much younger than you.

speaker: Gustave
line: Thanks.

speaker: Maelle
line: She’s popular, I’m sure she already has a necklace full of flowers.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hm. I can imagine.

speaker: Maelle
line: Hmm…

speaker: Gustave
line: What?

speaker: Maelle
line: You look tense.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, I, hum… Yeah.

speaker: Maelle
line: I know what you need! A little duel!

speaker: Gustave
line: No.

speaker: Maelle
line: Come on, it’ll loosen you up. You can’t go and see Sophie all sombre and tense.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hmmm…

speaker: Maelle
line: And… if you win, I’ll give you something you can use with your Lumina Converter.

speaker: Gustave
line: Alright, you’re on.

speaker: Maelle
line: Yes!

speaker: Maelle
line: You won! Now, don’t you feel better? I see your smile. All right, now let’s go find Sophie. I saw her near the red and white tree.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah.

speaker: Maelle
line: Oh, the Plaza is lively. Why people like to celebrate the Gommage is still a mystery to me, but, oh, well. The red and white tree… I’ve always found it beautiful. I don’t really understand. You and Sophie broke up so long ago. But clearly, you never got over her. Why’d you wait until today to say something? It’s a bit late, isn’t it? Sophie is down there.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, I know.

speaker: Maelle
line: I… Good luck. I’ll be here for you if things… don’t go as planned.

speaker: Gustave
line: Thanks.

speaker: Maelle
line: Come on, she’s down there. It’s your moment.

speaker: Sophie
line: …the last few days meant everything.

speaker: Gustave
line: …Could we talk?

speaker: Sophie
line: Gustave. I love you all.

speaker: Gustave
line: For your, um– If there’s room…

speaker: Sophie
line: There’s always room.

speaker: Gustave
line: You know, I’m sorry that…

speaker: Sophie
line: I missed you–

speaker: Gustave
line: I missed you too.

speaker: Sophie
line: You don’t need to– (laugh) Okay.

speaker: Gustave
line: You go.

speaker: Sophie
line: No, you.

speaker: Gustave
line: You, uh– You know how I fell. I– I wish things had been– You know… I often think– Another path, you know… Another future–

speaker: Sophie
line: Still can’t finish your sentences, can you?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, that hasn’t changed…

speaker: Sophie
line: I missed that. I never faulted you for wanting to believe. You’re fighting. To change things. I understand, I just… In a “different world”, right?

speaker: Gustave
line: We’ll break the cycle. So She can’t steal anyone else’s future.

speaker: Sophie
line: Stubborn people change the world. And you are the most stubborn person I know. Thank you. Walk me to the harbour?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yes.

speaker: Tiffanie
line: Oh, hi, Sophie. So Gustave really did come, huh?

speaker: Sophie
line: Hm, yeah, he did.

speaker: Tiffanie
line: I knew he would.

speaker: Sophie
line: Shh, he might hear us.

speaker: Tiffanie
line: You’re a lucky one, you know.

speaker: Sophie
line: I know that…

speaker: Tiffanie
line: But he is too.

speaker: Sophie
line: Looks like you still have a lot of flowers left.

speaker: Tiffanie
line: Well, there are less and less people to buy them… I just wish you didn’t have to wear one.

speaker: Sophie
line: Tiffanie…

speaker: Tiffanie
line: I should finish cleaning up here and join everyone at the harbour. See you.

speaker: Sophie
line: See you…

speaker: Gustave
line: I can’t imagine what you’re going through…

speaker: Sophie
line: I’m fine.

speaker: Gustave
line: (sceptical grunt)

speaker: Sophie
line: I’m FINE. I’ve lived 33 good years. Look around. We’ve had our whole lives to prepare. We’re all fine. Mostly.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m not fine.

speaker: Sophie
line: You will be.

speaker: narrator
line: People have gathered here, on their way to the harbour. Reuniting… one last time…

speaker: Marie
line: Oh… Sophie.

speaker: Sophie
line: Marie…

speaker: Marie
line: Your flowers… I didn’t know about… I thought you were younger. And yet you didn’t have children…

speaker: Sophie
line: I’m not having this conversation with you again. Not today.

speaker: Marie
line: Do you care so little about the future of Lumière? How can you be so selfish?

speaker: Sophie
line: I’m not selfish enough to bring others into our doomed world. I know we are not many to think like this now… And it destroyed my relationship with the person I loved the most. Now if you’ll excuse me, I’d like to spend this moment with him. And you should cherish this moment with your daughter.

speaker: Marie
line: … Sorry… See you at the harbour.

speaker: Sophie
line: Good luck, Marie.

speaker: Cyril
line: Ah, the scintillating Sophie! You’re as gorgeous as always!

speaker: Sophie
line: Cyril, you flatterer. Need some help with your writing again?

speaker: Cyril
line: Beautiful and perceptive, per usual. See, I’m preparing the headline for tomorrow, and who could write it better than someone who celebrates her special day today!

speaker: Sophie
line: Hm, true. So, what will the article be about?

speaker: Cyril
line: Actually…

speaker: Sophie
line: You don’t know?

speaker: Cyril
line: Well…

speaker: Sophie
line: You really are lazy.

speaker: Cyril
line: Help me again, Sophie, please. My boss will kill me…

speaker: Sophie
line: Sure, let me think of a headline…

speaker: Sophie
line: Expedition 33 shall be the destined journey.

speaker: Cyril
line: A headline about the Expedition… That’s bold. Nobody really cares about them anymore after their constant failures. But that would make a wonderful underdog story. Okay, now I’m inspired. You really are a divine being, Sophie.

speaker: Sophie
line: Don’t forget to credit me.

speaker: Cyril
line: I would never… Thank you for all these times.

speaker: Sophie
line: It’s always been a pleasure, my friend. Take care of yourself.

speaker: Cyril
line: Yeah…

speaker: Estelle
line: Hey, you. You seem like a woman with exquisite taste. I just finished my sculpture to the legendary Esquie. This may be my life’s finest work, yet not a single soul seems to care. How could I make it better?

speaker: Sophie
line: Perhaps you could paint it? Add some colours?

speaker: Estelle
line: Paint it? Hmm… Brilliant. I knew you were the right person to ask. Thank you for your insight!

speaker: Sophie
line: You’re most welcome.

speaker: Estelle
line: I shall get to work tomorrow. I see you’re wearing flowers. What’s your name?

speaker: Sophie
line: Sophie.

speaker: Estelle
line: Sophie, as a thank you, I shall chisel your name onto the statue.

speaker: Sophie
line: Oh, you don’t have to.

speaker: Estelle
line: But I will.

speaker: narrator
line: People who are about to Gommage leave their furniture. So the others may use them.

speaker: Sophie
line: (examine)

speaker: narrator
line: Sophie and Gustave examine the stuff left behind.

speaker: Gustave
line: We can use that.

speaker: narrator
line: The rest is better left for future generations.

speaker: Ulysse
line: My Gestral costume is the best! Hey, madame, do you think the Gestrals really exist?

speaker: Sophie
line: Of course they do!

speaker: Ulysse
line: That’s what I think too. The others laugh, but I know they’re real. One day, I will meet one. Even if it means joining an Expedition! I’ll raise a Gestral army and we’ll crush the Paintress! And me and my little brother will live with the Gestrals and they’ll be our new family. We’re tired of the orphanage… If the legends are true, they really like to fight. That’s why I’m training everyday by beating up my little brother!

speaker: Sophie
line: That’s… Yeah. You would make a great Gestral.

speaker: Ulysse
line: Thanks!

speaker: Richard
line: Oh, Sophie, what a lovely smell.

speaker: Sophie
line: Thank you, Richard.

speaker: Richard
line: I could recognize it from miles away. It’s good you’re here, Sophie. I have a favor to ask of you.

speaker: Sophie
line: Anything for my beloved sewing teacher.

speaker: Richard
line: I… We are of the same cohort. Today is my Gommage. And… My son and I had a fight last night. He said he wants to join the Expedition… He wants to waste the last years of his life. I… I didn’t want that for him. I used to think it was a bad choice, but today, I no longer do. I know I made a mistake. I tried to impose my views on him when he is much braver than I will ever be. So I sewed a special uniforme for him as my last gift. Could you bring it to him?

speaker: Sophie
line: Of course. I’ll bring it to Jules.

speaker: Richard
line: He won’t join the Gommage ceremony, but he will be at the Expedition Festival tonight for sure. Oh, but you…

speaker: Sophie
line: Don’t worry, I’ll ask Gustave.

speaker: Richard
line: Gustave? Are you back together?

speaker: Sophie
line: For this moment… Maybe.

speaker: Richard
line: I’m glad… He is a good person.

speaker: Sophie
line: Yes, he is…

speaker: Richard
line: Thanks to both of you. And see you.

speaker: Sophie
line: See you.

speaker: Eloise
line: Hm…

speaker: Sophie
line: Is something wrong?

speaker: Eloise
line: The Expeditions… What a joke.

speaker: Eloise
line: All they do is leave us here to die. They’re just escaping.

speaker: Sophie
line: You know their goal is to save us all, right?

speaker: Eloise
line: Yeah, that’s what my father told me last year. Before he left for Expedition 34. And here we are again this year. We could have spent one more year together instead of wasting it away…

speaker: Sophie
line: Your father fought to offer you a better future…

speaker: Eloise
line: I have no future. I know it and I’ve accepted it. We’re doomed.

speaker: Sophie
line: You never know, this Expedition might be different. There are some special people in this one.

speaker: Eloise
line: Yeah, right…

speaker: Sophie
line: Gustave? Why don’t you show her some of your fighting skills to prove her wrong?

speaker: Eloise
line: That’s… This guy is strong…

speaker: Sophie
line: They all train their Pictos skills very hard to save us all. And so did your father.

speaker: Eloise
line: Then, madam, why didn’t you join?

speaker: Sophie
line: Me? I’m content with my life. I know what I can and cannot change. Or maybe… Because I was afraid.

speaker: Eloise
line: … Do you think… I should join the Expedition?

speaker: Sophie
line: My friend Sciel always says, do your best, either it works or it doesn’t. Live your life as you want.

speaker: Eloise
line: I… I don’t want to have regrets… I don’t have that much time…

speaker: Sophie
line: When the time comes, you’ll make the right decision. I’m sure.

speaker: Eloise
line: Thank you. Now I think I know… Give this to your boyfriend, my father gave it to me, but it might be more useful for him.

speaker: narrator
line: They are trying to recruit for future Expeditions. The number of people volunteering is going down every year…

speaker: Raphaël
line: Why does Manon keep saying “death comes to us all?”

speaker: Gustave
line: You haven’t heard that before?

speaker: Raphaël
line: No?

speaker: Gustave
line: Unofficial Expedition motto. You never heard Lucien say it either? It’s one of his favourites.

speaker: Raphaël
line: I think he prefers “We’re already dead. You’re just catching up.”

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, I’ve heard that one recently.

speaker: Raphaël
line: I dunno, kinda nice in a way, having a “deadline.” Forces you to prioritise. It’s a bit freeing as we get closer to the end.

speaker: Gustave
line: You can really find the silver lining in everything, can’t you?

speaker: Raphaël
line: No, it’s just– Things don’t always work out the way we want. No use getting upset, ya know? Use what we can. Leave what we can’t.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hmm…

speaker: narrator
line: The Flower market. People are buying flowers for their loved ones, before they Gommage.

speaker: Ophélie
line: Hi, Gustave. You’re back. Did you want to pick out a different flower?

speaker: Gustave
line: No, the one you suggested earlier was perfect.

speaker: Ophélie
line: I’m glad. These garlands are our last farewell. I want them all to feel special. I have a garland saved for you, too. But it’s not a farewell garland. It will be a welcome home garland. Good luck… My friend.

speaker: Gustave
line: Thanks, Ophélie.

speaker: Sophie
line: Oh, Lune’s playing. You two would make a cute couple.

speaker: Gustave
line: If you say so.

speaker: Sophie
line: Or maybe… Something already happened, huh?

speaker: Maxime
line: You really think you’re doing something, eh? Out there?

speaker: Gustave
line: Maxime. You’re drunk.

speaker: Maxime
line: None of you ever come back. You go and you take our resources and you waste it all. On a fucked up hero adrenaline fantasy. And still, SHE kills us.

speaker: Gustave
line: You should go home. Where’s your daughter?

speaker: Maxime
line: Where do you THINK? Mourning her mother. On the ANNIVERSARY of her death. Of all their deaths.

speaker: Gustave
line: Then maybe you should be with her.

speaker: Maxime
line: I can’t. I can’t look at her. She’s just another reminder that nothing we do matters. Nothing. We hope and we “persevere” and still they die. They all die and we can’t stop it. We can’t save them. We bring another generation into this world just so they can watch us die before they’re even old enough to understand why.

speaker: Gustave
line: That’s why we’re going. We CAN save them. With our Lumina tech, the Paintress–

speaker: Maxime
line: THE PAINTRESS. What, what’s a scrawny shit like YOU gonna do to THE PAINTRESS. Eh? “We’re already dead. You’re just catching up.”

speaker: Gustave
line: Maxime.

speaker: Maxime
line: Forget it. “Bon voyage.”

speaker: narrator
line: A perfectly normal trash can. It is indeed a perfectly normal trash can. Nothing special to see here, just a trash can. Once again, a perfectly normal–

speaker: Trash-can Man
line: Hey you! You’ve been here for quite a while now! Can you leave? I don’t want to draw attention to myself. I turned 33 today, can you believe my luck? Why would my parents choose the worst time… But I have a strategy. If I hide inside here, the Paintress won’t think of Gommaging me. I’ve been hiding for six months now. So leave and don’t tell anyone I’m here! Ow! What’s that? It’s hurting my ass. Maybe you can use it? Move on, the Paintress must not know I’m here.

speaker: Nicolas
line: Hm… This lady truly is exquisite.

speaker: Sophie
line: In love?

speaker: Nicolas
line: Not quite. I am only in love with her art. My inspiration has been quite lacking recently. Nobody buys paintings anymore… Just because she is called The Paintress doesn’t mean painting is evil.

speaker: Sophie
line: Your canvas seems quite empty.

speaker: Nicolas
line: I need inspiration… But you… I can see you’re in love. With this fine gentleman, I suppose.

speaker: Sophie
line: We broke up.

speaker: Nicolas
line: That is of no consequence in the matters of love. But it is this passion I so fiercely desire in my painting. I know, how about showing me a dance of love and sorrow? I am also the official painter of the Opera. Will you help me? If you inspire me, you may become the main painting of Lumière’s Opera.

speaker: Sophie
line: Yes.

speaker: Nicolas
line: Fantastic. You may start. Here, gorgeous lady, take this paintbrush and show me your wrath.

speaker: Sophie
line: Okay, I guess.

speaker: Nicolas
line: Come on! Dodge your lady’s beautiful moves! That was splendid. One more time. Sublime! One last time! That was splendid! Splendid! I was so enthralled that I completed the painting in an instant.

speaker: Sophie
line: It’s nice… to know something of us will remain in the world after today. Thank you.

speaker: Nicolas
line: It is I who should thank you. It was a moving dance. I will propose it for the new Opera painting we have to do this year.

speaker: Sophie
line: I feel it wasn’t that impressive, but… okay.

speaker: Nicolas
line: Love will always be impressive. Also, take this as a gesture of appreciation. I see your “not boyfriend” is an Expeditioner. It may prove useful.

speaker: Sophie
line: Sometimes I feel sorry for her.

speaker: Gustave
line: Who, the– The Paintress??

speaker: Sophie
line: Look at her. She looks… sad. Maybe she’s a prisoner too. Stuck in the same cycle with us. Silly, huh?

speaker: Gustave
line: Only you could choose empathy at a moment like this.

speaker: Sophie
line: It’s one of the few choices I can make.

speaker: Gustave
line: I couldn’t do it.

speaker: Sophie
line: It’s ok. You don’t have to.

speaker: narrator
line: The Gommage is starting soon. Like every year, everyone is gathering at the harbour. Waiting for her to paint a new number.

speaker: Mielle
line: Oh, hi, Sophie.

speaker: Sophie
line: Oh? Mielle? I didn’t expect to see you here.

speaker: Mielle
line: I’m volunteering to help guide children who are losing their parents to the orphanage. Those who were not registered for foster families…

speaker: Sophie
line: How kind of you.

speaker: Mielle
line: I guess I can relate…

speaker: Sophie
line: Take care during the Expedition. Gustave told me a lot of wonderful things about you.

speaker: Mielle
line: About you too. I always told him you two should never have broken up.

speaker: Sophie
line: Look at these orphans, that’s… That’s where we disagreed. But I have hope that you and Gustave will change things, so no one has to go through this impossible choice again.

speaker: Mielle
line: Yeah… Let’s hope we will.

speaker: Sophie
line: See you.

speaker: Mielle
line: In the next life.

speaker: Florian
line: The Paintress is going to punish you! You blasphemers. The Gommage is our fault! We brought this upon ourselves. Because we dared to defy her!

speaker: Gustave
line: Another one of these Paintress worshippers. Best to ignore him.

speaker: narrator
line: A weird mime is standing here.

speaker: Sophie
line: Uh, hello?

speaker: narrator
line: The mime reacts. It attacks!

speaker: Sophie
line: Gustave, help! That’s… That was close. Thanks, Gustave. Did someone build this? There is something on its body.

speaker: narrator
line: Gustave destroyed the weird mime.

speaker: Henri
line: You’d have to be crazy to use Pictos on your own body.

speaker: Sophie
line: Why? Aren’t you enjoying the show?

speaker: Henri
line: Nah, the show’s great, but etching chroma onto your skin? oof, that’s brutal. And just for a dance? I’ll stick to painting Pictos on my machines, I’m not cuckoo enough to put them on my body.

speaker: Sophie
line: Could be useful though, the Expeditions rely on them quite heavily.

speaker: Henri
line: Eh, they’re crazy too. But at least, you can remove Pictos pretty easily if you change your mind.

speaker: narrator
line: People have gathered for the Gommage. The Paintress will soon wake.

speaker: Victor
line: Mate, I wish I was going with ya! If we could just send a bigger force. Get ALL of Lumière to just throw EVERYTHING we got at the bloody Paintress. Ahhh, but my brother would kill me. His number’s up soon, and I’m guardian for his kid.

speaker: Gustave
line: Uncle Victor. Suits you.

speaker: Victor
line: But Maelle! Quite the ballsy one, eh? No looking back for her. Bet she can’t wait to get outta here

speaker: Gustave
line: Not much hesitation on her part.

speaker: Victor
line: Nah, hesitation was never her style.

speaker: narrator
line: The people on the dock are the ones who won’t gommage. They are here to show their solidarity for those wearing flowers.

speaker: Sophie
line: I’ve always loved the Harbour.

speaker: narrator
line: The Paintress will awaken soon. And the Gommage will start. Sophie and Gustave move towards the harbour.

speaker: Sophie
line: I see your apprentices.

speaker: Alexandre
line: Gustave! Gustave!

speaker: Gustave
line: What–

speaker: Guillaume
line: Here. Sophie asked us to bring you your coat.

speaker: Alexandre
line: We sewed up the sleeves so you don’t have to keep rolling it up.

speaker: Gustave
line: You guys know how to sew?

speaker: Alexandre
line: Sophie helped us. Turns out, it’s not that hard! You really shoulda done this ages ago.

speaker: Gustave
line: You did this?

speaker: Sophie
line: Gentlemen, that was supposed to be between us, yeah? I wanted to do something. For you.

speaker: Gustave
line: Soph. Thanks, guys, this is– This is great. Thank you.

speaker: Alexandre
line: See you at the festival?

speaker: Guillaume
line: Don’t leave without saying goodbye.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, of course not. What? I know that face.

speaker: Sophie
line: You mean a lot to them. I can tell.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, they mean a lot to me too. Legacy can take many forms, right?

speaker: Sophie
line: Yeah.

speaker: Gustave
line: You taught me that.

speaker: Sophie
line: Hm. Right.

speaker: Gustave
line: Why?

speaker: Sophie
line: I… wanted to see you wearing it.

speaker: Gustave
line: Oh, you like uniforms now?

speaker: Sophie
line: This too is your legacy.

speaker: Gustave
line: In a way, it’s yours too.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m here.

speaker: Sophie
line: I know. I know.
